source_note: State baseline derived from Idaho DEQ solid waste rules and local recycling practices; local rules may vary.

organics.guidance: Backyard composting is allowed under IDAPA 58.01.06 for residential waste; commercial composting must follow DEQ facility guidance. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}
organics.bin: Green bin or yard waste cart (where local service available).
organics.notes: No statewide mandate for organics diversion; local composting programs vary. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean paper, cardboard, cartons; flatten boxes. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}
paper_cardboard.bin: Blue recycling bin or local mixed paper bin.
paper_cardboard.notes: No waxed or heavily soiled paper products. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}

glass_containers.guidance: Recycle glass bottles and jars (empty, rinsed). :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}
glass_containers.bin: Mixed recycling bin or local drop-off glass containers.
glass_containers.notes: Some areas donâ€™t accept broken glass, ceramics, or light bulbs. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}

metal_containers.guidance: Recycle aluminum, steel, and tin cans (empty, rinsed). :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}
metal_containers.notes: Labels OK; no large scrap metal or hazardous containers. :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}

plastics.guidance: Recycle plastic bottles and jugs labeled #1 or #2 (some programs accept #5). :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}
plastics.notes: No plastic bags, film, or Styrofoam in most curbside programs. :contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: Idaho does *not* have a statewide beverage container deposit law. :contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}
beverage_containers_crv.bin: Include in curbside recycling if accepted locally.

household_batteries.guidance: Lead-acid batteries must be recycled; other household batteries ideally go to battery drop-off or HHW collection. :contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}
household_batteries.bin: Take to battery recycling or hazardous waste site.
household_batteries.notes: Do not place batteries in regular trash or recycling bins (fire risk).
provenance: Idaho waste management / battery disposal rules

e_waste.guidance: Recycle electronics via local e-waste collection events or drop-off recycling sites.
e_waste.bin: Local e-waste drop-off or collection center.
e_waste.notes: Acceptance and rules vary by county.
provenance: Idaho DEQ solid waste / recycling guidance

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Plastic bags and film are not accepted in most curbside recycling.
plastic_bags_and_film.notes: They cause contamination and equipment issues. :contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12}

bulky_items.guidance: Bulky items (furniture, mattresses, appliances) require special pickup or drop-off at a disposal facility.
bulky_items.notes: Fees or appointments often required at local transfer stations.
provenance: Idaho DEQ solid waste facility rules
